alert.note: Alert for Eastern Teton; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 7:46AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Teton County through 830 AM MDT... At 745 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Choteau, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Choteau and Farmington. This includes the following highways... Highway 287 between mile markers 48 and 64. Highway 89 between mile markers 28 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Teton; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
